intro: Succisa pratensis var. vestita, commonly known as the white meadow cranesbill, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its upright, branching stems and small, white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in moist meadows and grasslands, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are palmately lobed and often have a velvety texture, contributing to its ornamental value. It blooms from June to August and is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of light conditions.
